title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a project management and organizational tool. This project utilizes the Next.js Pages Router, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and focuses on providing a clean, intuitive user interface for managing tasks, projects, and team collaboration. It's a practical example of modern web development best practices using cutting-edge technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard is a project built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed to provide a user interface for monitoring and interacting with a Robofleet system. This dashboard allows users to visualize robot data, manage tasks, and gain insights into robot fleet operations, offering a comprehensive view of the Robofleet environment.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project leveraging TypeScript and JavaScript to create [insert primary purpose of project, gleaned from README - e.g., a modern task management application, a data visualization dashboard, etc.]. This repository focuses on [mention key features or goals highlighted in the README - e.g., providing a user-friendly interface, efficient data processing, a scalable architecture, etc.], making it a valuable resource for developers interested in [mention target audience or use case - e.g., building web applications, exploring data analysis techniques, learning TypeScript best practices, etc.].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard implementation. This repository serves as a practical example of building a user interface with Next.js, focusing on clean code, reusable components, and best practices for front-end development. It explores key dashboard features and demonstrates how to structure a Next.js application effectively.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This project, centered around improving sleep habits, allows users to track their sleep patterns, calculate accumulated sleep debt, and understand the potential impact on their well-being, providing a valuable tool for personal health and productivity management.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using TeX for professional formatting and rendered into HTML for easy online accessibility. This personal project showcases my skills and experience in a clean, easily-updated format, serving as a template for creating and maintaining a polished resume.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a collaborative project management tool built with Next.js, TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS, allowing users to brainstorm, organize, and prioritize ideas using a dynamic Kanban-style board. It focuses on streamlining the idea generation process, providing a visual and interactive platform for teams and individuals to capture, develop, and track their projects from initial conception to implementation.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a simple and intuitive platform for creating and participating in polls. This project showcases best practices in modern web development and offers a robust solution for implementing voting systems in various applications. The repository focuses on demonstrating practical application of these technologies and serves as a learning resource for those interested in full-stack web development.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, utilizing Supabase for backend services. The project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for real-time asset monitoring, leveraging efficient data management and a responsive design. It demonstrates best practices for developing scalable and maintainable web applications with serverless technologies.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project providing a customizable and interactive event calendar. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, it allows users to dynamically add, view, and manage events, offering a visually appealing and user-friendly experience. This project showcases front-end development skills and provides a practical solution for organizing and displaying events in a web application.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python and Flask, utilizing a PostgreSQL database for data persistence and styled with HTML and CSS. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of common web development principles, showcasing how to create, read, update, and delete data through a user-friendly interface, making it a valuable learning resource for those interested in Python web development and database integration.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project leveraging HTML and Python to create interactive map visualizations. This repository showcases the process of generating and displaying map data, potentially including features like data overlays, custom markers, and dynamic updates, making it a valuable resource for learning about geographic data representation and web-based map integration. It falls under the broader topics of data visualization and web development.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Jupyter Notebooks and Python code for various finance-related projects and analyses. It explores concepts like portfolio optimization, stock price prediction, and financial data visualization, providing practical examples of leveraging Python for financial modeling and analysis. The projects aim to showcase how to apply Python libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib to solve real-world financial problems.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on [insert project purpose or brief functionality here - e.g., creating an interactive world map, visualizing global data, or showcasing a specific dataset]. This repository serves as the central codebase for the project, encompassing both front-end and potentially back-end elements necessary to achieve its goals, and falls under the project topic.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and display ROS logs, aiding developers in debugging and understanding robot system behavior. It leverages a combination of backend processing and frontend visualization techniques to effectively manage and present complex log data.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, leveraging Vite.js for a fast development experience and Express.js for the backend API. It utilizes the Gemini API to provide users with [insert a brief, impactful description of what the application does, e.g., AI-powered conversation and information retrieval or creative content generation]. The project demonstrates best practices in modern web development and explores the integration of AI services within a web application context.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully functional e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and React. It leverages MUI for a responsive and accessible user interface, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and aims to provide a type-safe and scalable foundation for selling fruits online. This project serves as a practical example for learning modern web development techniques and best practices within the e-commerce domain.
